document_title: Postpartum infection: Causes, symptoms and consequences
subsection_content: Postpartum infections can be caused by a number of bacteria such as staphylococcus, streptococcus, E. coli, anaerobic bacteria such as Clostridium, Bacteroides... The route of transmission to cause infection can be from the vagina. through the cervix, through the fallopian tube into the peritoneum; At the same time, bacteria can also penetrate through the placenta into the blood, causing blood infection.
subsection_title: nhiem trung hau san.json. Causes of postpartum infection
subsection_data:
nhiem trung hau san.json. Causes of postpartum infection
Postpartum infections can be caused by a number of bacteria such as staphylococcus, streptococcus, E. coli, anaerobic bacteria such as Clostridium, Bacteroides... The route of transmission to cause infection can be from the vagina. through the cervix, through the fallopian tube into the peritoneum; At the same time, bacteria can also penetrate through the placenta into the blood, causing blood infection.
